title: Stat Mania IELTS Docs
text: This websites acts as a catalog of useful resources on IELTS.

title: Stat Mania IELTS Docs
text:
IELTS Academic Test Format







Section
About




Listening* (30 minutes)
Four recorded monologues and conversations


Reading (60 mintues)
- Three long reading passages with tasks - Texts may include diagrams, graphs or illustrations - Texts are taken from books, journals, magazines and newspapers


Writing (60 mintues)
- Summarise, describe or explain a table, graph, chart or diagram - Short eassy task of at least 250 words


Speaking* (11 to 14 mintues)
- Face-to-Face interview without disruptions or distractions - Incldues short questions, speaking at length about a familiar topic and a structured discussion



Learn more

IELTS Liz, IELTS Simon, IELTS Advantage blogs â†’ They have lots of sample Task 1 essays with charts/graphs.




ðŸ”¹ General Data Description & Reports (real-life style)

UK Office for National Statistics (ONS) â†’ https://www.ons.gov.uk They publish clear, concise reports with charts, percentages, and trends â€” very similar to IELTS charts.
World Bank Data Blog â†’ https://blogs.worldbank.org/opendata Lots of global charts and analysis, written in simple English.
Our World in Data â†’ https://ourworldindata.org Data stories with graphs, trends, and comparisons (perfect for IELTS-style reading).
OECD Statistics reports â†’ https://www.oecd.org/statistics/ Short summaries of country-level data, very similar to IELTS Task 1.
